title: Ezekiel Chapter 39 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Ezekiel chapter 39 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Ezekiel Chapter 39 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Ezekiel Chapter 39.

questions.question: Who is God speaking against in Ezekiel 39:1?
questions.correctAnswer: Gog
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:1 states that God commands to prophesy against Gog, the chief prince of Meshech and Tubal.

questions.question: From which direction will Gog come according to Ezekiel 39:2?
questions.correctAnswer: North parts
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:2 says Gog will come from the north parts to the mountains of Israel.

questions.question: What will happen to Gog's bow according to Ezekiel 39:3?
options: It will be smitten out of his left hand
It will be given to Israel
It will be lost in battle
questions.correctAnswer: It will be smitten out of his left hand
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:3 declares that God will smite Gog's bow out of his left hand.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 39:4, who will devour Gog and his bands?
questions.correctAnswer: Ravenous birds and beasts
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:4 states Gog and his bands will be given to ravenous birds and beasts of the field to be devoured.

questions.question: True or False: Ezekiel 39:5 says Gog shall fall upon the mountains only.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:5 specifies Gog shall fall upon the open field, not just the mountains.

questions.question: What will God send on Magog as stated in Ezekiel 39:6?
questions.correctAnswer: Fire
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:6 says God will send a fire on Magog and those dwelling carelessly in the isles.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 39:7, what will God make known in the midst of Israel?
questions.correctAnswer: His holy name
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:7 says God will make His holy name known in the midst of His people Israel.

questions.question: How long will the people of Israel burn the weapons according to Ezekiel 39:9?
questions.correctAnswer: Seven years
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:9 states they will burn the weapons with fire for seven years.

questions.question: What is the name of the valley where Gog and his multitude will be buried as per Ezekiel 39:11?
questions.correctAnswer: The valley of Hamongog
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:11 says the valley where Gog and his multitude are buried will be called The valley of Hamongog.

questions.question: True or False: The house of Israel will bury the dead for seven months according to Ezekiel 39:12.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:12 states Israel will spend seven months burying them to cleanse the land.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 39:17, who does God call to assemble for a great sacrifice?
options: Feathered fowl and beasts of the field
questions.correctAnswer: Feathered fowl and beasts of the field
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:17 commands every feathered fowl and beast to assemble for God's great sacrifice.

questions.question: What will the beasts and birds eat according to Ezekiel 39:18?
options: The flesh of the mighty and princes of the earth
questions.correctAnswer: The flesh of the mighty and princes of the earth
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:18 states they will eat the flesh of the mighty and princes of the earth, including rams, lambs, goats, and bullocks.

questions.question: True or False: Ezekiel 39:22 says the house of Israel will know God is their God from that day forward.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:22 confirms Israel will know the LORD their God from that day forward.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 39:25, what will God bring again to the house of Israel?
questions.correctAnswer: The captivity of Jacob
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:25 declares God will bring again the captivity of Jacob and have mercy on Israel.

questions.question: Complete the verse from Ezekiel 39:29: 'Neither will I hide my face any more from them: for I have poured out my ______ upon the house of Israel.'
questions.correctAnswer: spirit
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:29 states God has poured out his spirit upon the house of Israel.

medium.title: Ezekiel Chapter 39 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Ezekiel Chapter 39 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with trusting God during a difficult trial. Based on Ezekiel 39, what biblical truth would you share about God's control?
options: God is against evil leaders and will bring justice
God allows evil to triumph without consequence
God is indifferent to the struggles of His people
God punishes the innocent along with the guilty
questions.correctAnswer: God is against evil leaders and will bring justice
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:1-4 shows that God opposes Gog, a chief prince of evil, and will execute judgment on him. This teaches us that God controls events and brings justice even when trials seem overwhelming.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 39 teach us about the importance of trusting God's timing in deliverance?
options: God's promises will be fulfilled at the appointed time
We should force God's hand to act quickly
Deliverance comes only through human effort
God forgets His promises after a time
questions.correctAnswer: God's promises will be fulfilled at the appointed time
questions.explanation: Verse 8 says, 'Behold, it is come, and it is done,' emphasizing that God's promises come to pass when He decides, teaching patience and trust in His timing (Ezekiel 39:8).

questions.question: What does Ezekiel 39 teach about stewardship and contentment in times of peace?
options: During peace, people will burn weapons for seven years instead of cutting trees
People will increase weapon production continuously
People will neglect care for the land
People will rely only on themselves for security
questions.correctAnswer: During peace, people will burn weapons for seven years instead of cutting trees
questions.explanation: Verses 9-10 describe how Israelites will burn weapons for seven years and refrain from cutting wood, illustrating contentment and proper stewardship in peaceful times.

questions.question: A believer is discouraged by past failures and shame. According to Ezekiel 39, what hope can you share about God's mercy?
options: God will bring back the captivity of Jacob and have mercy
God will permanently reject those who fail
God forgets His people after punishment
questions.correctAnswer: God will bring back the captivity of Jacob and have mercy
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:25 highlights God's promise to restore Israel and show mercy after their shame, teaching us about God's compassion and restoration.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 39 emphasize the importance of holiness and God's name in the life of believers?
options: God will make His holy name known and not allow it to be polluted
God's name can be used carelessly without consequence
Believers have no role in honoring God's name
God hides His name from those who follow Him
questions.correctAnswer: God will make His holy name known and not allow it to be polluted
questions.explanation: Verse 7 states God will make His holy name known among Israel and prevent its pollution, teaching us to honor God's name in our conduct.

questions.question: What practical lesson about perseverance through trials can be learned from the burial of Gog's multitude?
options: Israel will persevere in cleansing the land by burying the dead for seven months
They will ignore the consequences and leave the dead unburied
They will give up quickly due to the burden
They will blame others for the situation
questions.correctAnswer: Israel will persevere in cleansing the land by burying the dead for seven months
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:12-14 reveals Israel's dedicated effort to cleanse the land by burying the dead for seven months, illustrating perseverance through difficult tasks.

questions.question: A believer struggles with doubt about God's presence during exile. How does Ezekiel 39 provide encouragement about God's relationship with His people?
options: God will not hide His face anymore and will pour out His Spirit
God will remain distant and silent forever
God punishes without hope of restoration
God forgets those who are captive
questions.correctAnswer: God will not hide His face anymore and will pour out His Spirit
questions.explanation: Verse 29 promises God will no longer hide His face and will pour out His Spirit, encouraging believers about God's nearness and restoration.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 39 teach us about humility and the consequences of sin?
options: Israel was led into captivity because of their iniquity and trespassing
questions.correctAnswer: Israel was led into captivity because of their iniquity and trespassing
questions.explanation: Verses 23-24 explain Israel's captivity was due to their sin, teaching the need for humility and repentance.

questions.question: What does the passage teach about faithfulness in serving God despite trials?
options: God will sanctify His people and be glorified among many nations
God abandons His people in trials
Trials are always a sign of God's rejection
questions.correctAnswer: God will sanctify His people and be glorified among many nations
questions.explanation: Verse 27 shows God will sanctify His people and be glorified, encouraging believers to remain faithful through trials.

questions.question: True or False: Ezekiel 39 teaches that God's judgment is visible to all nations and demonstrates His glory.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 21 states God will set His glory among the nations so all will see His judgment, showing His power and justice.

questions.question: True or False: According to Ezekiel 39, the people of Israel will forget God's acts and fail to recognize Him as their God after restoration.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 22 says that from that day forward, Israel will know the LORD their God, affirming their remembrance and recognition of God after restoration.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Ezekiel 39 instructs that the people of Israel shall burn their weapons with fire for _____ years to cleanse the land.
questions.correctAnswer: Seven
questions.explanation: Verses 9-10 specify burning weapons for seven years to cleanse the land, symbolizing thorough purification and peace.

questions.question: Based on Ezekiel 39, what lesson can be drawn about generosity and sharing in God’s victory?
options: God invites birds and beasts to feast on the defeated, symbolizing sharing the spoils
Victory is only for a select few without sharing
Victory should be kept secret and not celebrated
questions.correctAnswer: God invites birds and beasts to feast on the defeated, symbolizing sharing the spoils
questions.explanation: Verses 17-20 describe a great sacrifice where birds and beasts feast on the defeated, symbolizing God's provision and sharing of victory blessings.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 39 encourage believers to maintain integrity and honesty when dealing with others who have wronged them?
options: God promises that those who spoiled Israel will themselves be spoiled
Dishonesty is acceptable to gain advantage
Ignoring injustice is the best response
questions.correctAnswer: God promises that those who spoiled Israel will themselves be spoiled
questions.explanation: Verse 10 teaches that those who wronged Israel will be repaid, encouraging believers to trust God's justice rather than personal revenge.

questions.question: What does Ezekiel 39 teach about the importance of spiritual discipline in recognizing God's work?
options: Israel will know the LORD their God from that day and forward after witnessing His judgment
Spiritual discipline is unnecessary for understanding God
God’s work is hidden from His people
Recognition of God is based on human wisdom alone
questions.correctAnswer: Israel will know the LORD their God from that day and forward after witnessing His judgment
questions.explanation: Verse 22 emphasizes that through God's acts, Israel will recognize Him, highlighting the role of spiritual awareness and discipline.

hard.title: Ezekiel Chapter 39 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Ezekiel Chapter 39.

questions.question: Who is identified as the 'chief prince of Meshech and Tubal' in Ezekiel 39?
questions.correctAnswer: Gog
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:1 explicitly names Gog as the chief prince of Meshech and Tubal.

questions.question: What does God say He will do to Gog's bow and arrows?
options: Smite the bow out of his left hand and cause arrows to fall from his right hand
Give them to Israel as spoils
questions.correctAnswer: Smite the bow out of his left hand and cause arrows to fall from his right hand
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:3 states that God will smite Gog's bow out of his left hand and cause arrows to fall from his right hand, signifying disarmament.

questions.question: The valley where Gog and his multitude are buried is called what?
questions.correctAnswer: The valley of Hamongog
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:11 names the burial place of Gog and his multitude as The valley of Hamongog.

questions.question: How long will the people of Israel burn the weapons of Gog and his bands?
questions.correctAnswer: Seven years
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:9 states that the weapons will be burned for seven years to prevent cutting wood from fields or forests.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 39, what will the birds and beasts do on the mountains of Israel?
options: Eat the flesh and drink the blood of the mighty
questions.correctAnswer: Eat the flesh and drink the blood of the mighty
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:17-20 describes a great sacrificial feast for birds and beasts to eat the flesh and drink the blood of the fallen warriors.

questions.question: What does God say will be made known among the heathen when He executes judgment on Gog?
questions.correctAnswer: His glory and judgment
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:21 states that God will set His glory among the heathen and they will see His judgment executed.

questions.question: Which theme present in Ezekiel 39 is also emphasized in Deuteronomy 28 regarding Israel's captivity and restoration?
options: Punishment for iniquity and eventual restoration
questions.correctAnswer: Punishment for iniquity and eventual restoration
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:23-29 echoes Deuteronomy 28’s themes where Israel’s captivity is due to iniquity but God promises restoration and mercy.

questions.question: What is the significance of the phrase 'I have poured out my spirit upon the house of Israel' in the context of Ezekiel 39?
options: It indicates a future spiritual renewal and divine presence
It condemns Israel for their sins
It refers to the spirit of fear among enemies
questions.correctAnswer: It indicates a future spiritual renewal and divine presence
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:29 concludes with God's promise not to hide His face and to pour out His Spirit, signifying spiritual restoration.

questions.question: Which ancient Near Eastern peoples are referenced as being under judgment alongside Gog and his armies?
options: Magog and those dwelling carelessly in the isles
questions.correctAnswer: Magog and those dwelling carelessly in the isles
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:6 mentions a fire sent upon Magog and those dwelling carelessly in the isles, indicating their judgment.

questions.question: True or False: The cleansing of the land after the battle with Gog involves a seven-month period of burying the dead.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:12 states that Israel will spend seven months burying the dead to cleanse the land.

questions.question: What is the purpose of placing signs next to human bones found in the land, according to Ezekiel 39?
options: To ensure they are buried properly in the valley of Hamongog
To mark ancient battlefields for future generations
To warn travelers of dangerous areas
To decorate the land with symbols of victory
questions.correctAnswer: To ensure they are buried properly in the valley of Hamongog
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:15 explains that signs are set by bones until buriers can bury them in the designated valley.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 39 portray the restoration of Israel's reputation among the nations?
options: By cleansing the land and glorifying God's name
questions.correctAnswer: By cleansing the land and glorifying God's name
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:7 and 39:13 emphasize making God's holy name known and Israel being glorified as a result of God's actions.

questions.question: What literary device is illustrated by the repeated motif of God revealing His name and glory in Ezekiel 39?
questions.correctAnswer: Theophany
questions.explanation: Theophany, a visible manifestation of God’s presence and glory, is strongly implied as God reveals His name and judgment (Ezekiel 39:7, 39:21).

questions.question: Which Old Testament book also describes a great eschatological battle involving Gog and Magog, providing intertextual context to Ezekiel 39?
questions.correctAnswer: Revelation
questions.explanation: Revelation 20:7-9 references Gog and Magog in the context of a final battle, connecting to Ezekiel’s prophecy.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: God declares He will not let the house of Israel ______ His holy name anymore.
questions.correctAnswer: pollute
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:7 states God will not let Israel pollute His holy name any more, indicating restoration of holiness.

theological.title: Ezekiel Chapter 39 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Ezekiel Chapter 39 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: In Ezekiel 39, who is identified as the chief prince against whom God prophesies?
questions.correctAnswer: Gog
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:1 names Gog as the chief prince of Meshech and Tubal against whom God speaks. This figure represents a hostile power opposed to God's people, consistent with prophetic imagery in Revelation 20:8 and Psalm 83:1-8.

questions.question: What does God say He will do to Gog and his armies in Ezekiel 39?
options: Leave only a sixth of them alive
Destroy them completely with no survivors
Send them into exile in Babylon
questions.correctAnswer: Leave only a sixth of them alive
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:2 states God will turn Gog back, leaving only a sixth of them, showing divine judgment with partial destruction, which echoes divine judgments in 2 Chronicles 15:9 and Isaiah 10:22.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 39, what will happen to the weapons of war after the defeat of Gog?
options: They will be burned for seven years
They will be buried in the valley of Hamongog
They will be given as spoils to Israel's enemies
They will be melted into idols
questions.correctAnswer: They will be burned for seven years
questions.explanation: In Ezekiel 39:9, the people of Israel burn the weapons for seven years, symbolizing complete disarmament and peace, similar to Isaiah 2:4 where swords are turned into plowshares.

questions.question: What is the significance of the valley called Hamongog in Ezekiel 39?
options: It is the burial place of Gog and his multitude
It is the place where Israel will worship
It is the future capital of Israel
It is a city of refuge for Israel
questions.correctAnswer: It is the burial place of Gog and his multitude
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:11 identifies the valley of Hamongog as the burial site for Gog and his army, illustrating God's judgment, paralleling the Valley of Jehoshaphat in Joel 3:2 where God judges nations.

questions.question: For how long will the house of Israel bury the dead of Gog’s army to cleanse the land?
questions.correctAnswer: Seven months
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:12 explains that Israel will spend seven months burying the dead to purify the land, reflecting the biblical importance of ritual cleansing found in Leviticus 14 and Numbers 19.

questions.question: What is the purpose of setting up signs by the bones found in the land, as described in Ezekiel 39?
options: To mark them until the buriers can inter them properly
To claim the land for Israel
questions.correctAnswer: To mark them until the buriers can inter them properly
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:15 states signs are set by bones until buriers can bury them, highlighting careful cleansing of the land, in line with burial customs in Genesis 50:25 and Exodus 13:19.

questions.question: In Ezekiel 39, to whom does God call to assemble and feast on the sacrifice?
options: Every feathered fowl and beast of the field
questions.correctAnswer: Every feathered fowl and beast of the field
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:17 commands birds and beasts to gather for a great sacrifice, symbolizing God's judgment on the enemies of Israel, consistent with prophetic imagery in Revelation 19:17-18.

questions.question: What does God say will be revealed among the heathen through the judgment on Gog?
questions.correctAnswer: His glory and judgment
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:21 states God's glory and judgment will be made known among the heathen, affirming the universal recognition of God's sovereignty as seen also in Psalm 97:6-9 and Romans 1:18-20.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 39, why was Israel taken into captivity among the heathen?
options: Because of their iniquity and trespasses
questions.correctAnswer: Because of their iniquity and trespasses
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:23 explains Israel’s captivity was due to their sin, reflecting the biblical principle of divine discipline for disobedience as seen in Deuteronomy 28 and Jeremiah 25:11-12.

questions.question: What does God promise to do for the whole house of Israel after they have borne their shame and trespasses?
options: Bring them back from captivity and have mercy
Make them enemies of the nations
questions.correctAnswer: Bring them back from captivity and have mercy
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:25 promises restoration and mercy for Israel after repentance, consistent with God's covenant faithfulness in Jeremiah 30:3 and Isaiah 43:5-6.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 39 describe God's attitude toward His holy name in relation to Israel?
options: He will not let it be polluted anymore
questions.correctAnswer: He will not let it be polluted anymore
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:7 asserts God will protect His holy name from being profaned by Israel's enemies, affirming God's holiness and covenantal honor as in Exodus 34:14 and Leviticus 22:32.

questions.question: What spiritual blessing does God say He will pour out on the house of Israel in Ezekiel 39?
questions.correctAnswer: His Spirit
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39:29 reveals God will pour out His Spirit on Israel, a promise of restoration and renewal aligning with Joel 2:28-29 and Acts 2:17-18.

questions.question: Which attributes of God are prominently displayed in Ezekiel 39 through His actions against Gog and for Israel?
questions.correctAnswer: Justice, holiness, mercy, and sovereignty
questions.explanation: The chapter demonstrates God's justice in judging Gog (39:1-6), holiness in protecting His name (39:7), mercy in restoring Israel (39:25-27), and sovereignty over nations (39:21-22), consistent with Exodus 34:6-7 and Romans 11:33-36.

questions.question: What eschatological theme is illustrated by the defeat of Gog and the restoration of Israel in Ezekiel 39?
options: The final victory of God over evil and the gathering of His people
The abandonment of Israel to foreign powers
The establishment of a temporary political kingdom
questions.correctAnswer: The final victory of God over evil and the gathering of His people
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 39 portrays God's ultimate triumph over enemies and the restoration of Israel, reflecting New Testament eschatology in Revelation 20:7-10 and Matthew 24:29-31.

questions.question: What does the burning of weapons for seven years symbolize in the theological context of Ezekiel 39?
options: A prolonged period of peace and disarmament
A time of continuous war and violence
questions.correctAnswer: A prolonged period of peace and disarmament
questions.explanation: The seven-year burning of weapons (39:9-10) symbolizes enduring peace where war is no more, echoing Isaiah 2:4 and Micah 4:3's vision of peace and transformation of instruments of war.
